item.title: The SA premier faced one of his most bruising weeks yet. Will it matter come election time?
item.description: The dramatic cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week spiralled the news cycle out of Premier Peter Malinauskas's control. But will the saga actually mean anything come the March state election?

item.title: Unauthorised ski race planned for Lake Bonney despite national suspension
item.description: A water ski racing group has planned an alleged unsanctioned racing event in South Australia, which the state's Department for Infrastructure and Transport says it has not approved. It comes as the peak body for the sport has nationally suspended racing due to safety concerns.

item.title: Brisbane residents swap apartments for boats as the cost of housing continues to rise
item.description: Living at Brisbane’s Kangaroo Point overlooking the river would typically come with a hefty price tag, but some residents have found an alternative.

item.title: Nelson Asofa-Solomona announces plans to 'clean up the whole NRL division' after successful boxing debut
item.description: Nelson Asofa-Solomona calls out his former rugby league competitors after making a successful transition to the fight game by knocking out Jeremy Latimore.

item.title: Sydney Aboriginal inmate's connection to country stays strong through art
item.description: With each paint stroke and dot placement, art gives John the opportunity to express his culture, with some of his fellow Aboriginal inmates joining him in creating artworks while incarcerated.

item.title: Tasty one-tray lemon garlic chicken with green beans and potatoes - ABC News
item.description: This bright and flavourful chicken tray bake take just 15 minutes to prep and bakes in one tray.

item.title: Age-old 'seat of knowledge' tradition alive and well in North Queensland
item.description: Every day in these North Queensland towns, familiar faces gather to have a yarn in public spaces — just as people have done for centuries.

item.title: Outback NSW lake home to hundreds of turtles set to run dry in 130-year first
item.description: Imperial Lakes Nature Park may soon dry out for the first time in over a century, creating an environmental crisis for the region and the hundreds of native animals that call the lakes home.

item.title: Darwin midwife banned from working unsupervised handed $1.1 million NT government contract
item.description: Darwin midwife Claire Marks, who has been placed under a number of conditions by Australia's medical regulator, will continue to run the Northern Territory government's new private practice midwifery service, it's been confirmed.

item.title: Linguists and First Nations community work together to 'awaken' Bunurong language
item.description: After more than a century of silence, the Bunurong language is being brought back to life by elders, linguists and community.

item.title: Taking paracetamol during pregnancy not linked to autism or ADHD in children, Lancet study finds
item.description: Just months after US President Donald Trump warned women about taking paracetamol during pregnancy, a new study finds there is no evidence linking the painkiller to autism in children.

item.title: Greek tourist Ioannis Vidiniotis flooded with support after tragic accident at Cottesloe Beach
item.description: A young Greek tourist is flooded with donations and support after a tragic accident at Perth's most iconic beach left him with life-changing injuries.

item.title: Fishers and authorities in WA's Gascoyne fear overfishing after demersal ban
item.description: Fishing stocks have rebounded in WA's Gascoyne with authorities hoping it will model recovery efforts statewide. But that success could be undone by fishers fleeing restrictions.

item.title: Geraldton's Horizon Ball sculpture draws large crowds as international visitor numbers rise
item.description: Geraldton's Horizon Ball sculpture is drawing huge crowds of tourists after the spot gained international attention on social media.

item.title: US Justice Department opens criminal investigation into Minnesota officials
item.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz says the federal justice system is being weaponised to intimidate Donald Trump's perceived political enemies.

item.title: Labor separates gun control laws from hate speech reforms after bill turned down by Coalition and Greens
item.description: The Albanese government will separate laws tightening gun control from its proposed hate speech reforms after the omnibus bill failed to secure the support of the Coalition and the Greens.

item.title: Myanmar denies deadly Rohingya campaign amounts to genocide
item.description: The South-East Asian country's armed forces launched an offensive in 2017 that forced over 700,000 ethnic Rohingya from their homes into neighbouring Bangladesh.

item.title: Chinese debate Iran crisis as official and public views diverge
item.description: As protests rage in Iran, Chinese netizens are openly debating freedom, repression and global power politics, even as Beijing keeps its criticism focused on Washington.

item.title: Michael Zerafa has been accused of quitting against Nikita Tszyu. There is no more heinous crime in boxing
item.description: To be called a quitter is the lowest insult in boxing. But whether Michael Zerafa was guilty of this or not, he has successfully ostracised himself from the sport's fraternity for the second time in his career.

item.title: Machado's peace prize gift shows she's betting on a future with Trump
item.description: Lacking leverage with the United States, María Machado makes a calculated move to gift her Nobel Peace Prize to President Donald Trump. It underscores her willingness to think long-term.

item.title: Woman dies after tree falls on her car south of Wollongong as winds and rain lash NSW coast
item.description: Emergency services were called to the Illawarra Highway near Clover Hill Road just before 4pm after a tree branch fell onto a passing vehicle on a busy road.

item.title: 'I'm back!' Australian cricket great Damien Martyn shares heartfelt update on remarkable recovery
item.description: Australian cricket great Damien Martyn has paid tribute to the support he has received during his remarkable recovery from meningitis, while revealing he was given a "50:50 chance" of surviving the illness.

item.title: Thousands protest in Denmark, chanting 'Greenland is not for sale' in response to Trump's threats
item.description: Chanting "Greenland is not for sale" and carrying banners saying "Hands off Greenland", thousands of people have marched in Denmark, responding to US President Donald Trump's ambitions to acquire the Artic island.

item.title: Iran Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei blames Donald Trump for inciting deadly protests
item.description: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ali Khamenei, has labelled Donald Trump a criminal, blaming him for the deaths of thousands of demonstrators and security forces.

item.title: How charging board or rent to adult children can help them and you
item.description: Experts on the benefit of charging board and expenses if you’re sharing a home with young adults, and how to calculate it.

item.title: Russian President Vladimir Putin wants to 'make a different world' and Iran is vital to his plan
item.description: Tehran is the epicentre of the nightly protests shaking Iran's regime, but the reverberations are being felt loud and clear in Moscow, too.

item.title: Liberal Party election autopsy delayed after Peter Dutton suggests report defames him and his staff
item.description: The report, co-authored by Liberal grandees Pru Goward and Nick Minchin, has now been sent to a legal team to ensure it is watertight while the party decides what step to take next.

item.title: Donald Trump announces tariffs for eight countries as Greenland stand-off continues
item.description: Donald Trump announces the escalating tariffs for Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland as a row over Greenland continues.

item.title: BHP gaining ground as CBA loses its shine in market power struggle
item.description: The year is barely underway but already there's a power struggle between our biggest corporations as they fight it out for line honours.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Refreshed after a break and ready to flex your trivia muscle?
item.description: Wow, you really don't quit. Let's see how poorly you perform this week.

item.title: Australian woman documents her stint in Chinese weight loss 'prison'
item.description: Camps offering intensive weight loss programs are on the rise in China as the country faces skyrocketing obesity rates.

item.title: Sam Kerr scores twice for Chelsea in Women's FA Cup, declares her best form is not far away
item.description: Sam Kerr declares she is approaching her best form after scoring twice for Chelsea in a Women's FA Cup victory over Crystal Palace.

item.title: Supreme Court case continues despite more than 200 interpreter errors
item.description: A Victorian Supreme Court trial is forging ahead with amended transcripts after an interpreter made more than 200 translation errors during a key witness' evidence.

item.title: Grandmother's support group becomes a lifeline for Lithgow
item.description: It started as a Facebook page and now it is a vital charity. Here is how this group run by grandmothers is fighting loneliness in the NSW Blue Mountains.

item.title: Mount Lofty Ranges koala population boom risks starvation, study finds
item.description: South Australia's Mount Lofty Ranges is experiencing a koala population boom that would likely lead to starvation and deaths, researchers say.

item.title: Forgotten tracks from the 2005 Hottest 100 you need to hear again
item.description: We've dug out some standout tracks from the Hottest 100 of 2005 that you need to hear again. Relive the mid-2000s music that defined an era.

item.title: Bourke artist Jenny Greentree's career sprouted during millennium drought
item.description: Jenny and Steve Greentree's young family faced losing everything in the millennium drought. Twenty years on, their thriving art gallery has helped to put Bourke on the map.

item.title: Women's Tour Down Under first stage marred by crashes to Australian Liv Jayco AlUla team
item.description: The Australian Liv AlUla Jayco team is out to rescue its women's Tour Down Under campaign after a painful start in Saturday's opening stage.

item.title: Why Abbey Barrett's mum wants more federal government funding for brain cancer research
item.description: Abbey was "joy on two legs" and now she is gone, another lost to brain cancer. Somehow her family must carry on, as the fight continues for more funding to bring this horror disease to an end.

item.title: Flash flooding, heavy rainfall and gusty weather keeps SES busy on NSW coast
item.description: The State Emergency Service responds to more than 2,300 incidents and 25 flood rescues, most of which involve people driving through floodwaters.

item.title: Torres Strait Islanders commemorate the legacy of 1936 pearl industry maritime strike
item.description: Fed up with restrictions over what they earned and where they could go, pearl boat workers embarked on nine months of industrial action that would change the face of their communities forever. Ninety years on, their legacy is still felt across the Torres Strait.

item.title: Protesters march through Copenhagen to oppose US plan to seize Greenland
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Israel objects to US announcement of leaders who will help oversee next steps in Gaza
item.description: The committee announced by the White House includes no Israeli officials but has an Israeli businessperson, billionaire Yakir Gabay.

item.title: Victoria's animal populations suffer as state is ravaged by bushfires, extreme heat
item.description: From animal shelters to "entire generations" of bat colonies, heartbreaking stories of the significant loss of animal life are beginning to emerge in the wake of Victoria's disastrous bushfires and severe heat.

item.title: Status of hate laws remains uncertain as politicians converge on Canberra
item.description: A special sitting to respond to the Bondi terror attack will begin in Canberra on Monday, but the government is no closer to landing changes to hate laws.

item.title: NBA great Allen Iverson meets hundreds of fans in Australia, including NBL star Bryce Cotton
item.description: NBA great Allen Iverson left hundreds of fans star struck at a meet-and-greet event in Perth, none more so than one of the best NBL players of all time.

item.title: Pasa Faho to screen at Sydney Opera House after creating a bit of buzz
item.description: Pasa Faho is the story of a shoe salesman who struggles to save his small business and pass on his values to his son.

item.title: World's first legally binding treaty to protect oceans and marine life takes effect
item.description: The High Seas Treaty will govern about two-thirds of the planet's oceans including vast areas beyond any country's borders.

item.title: Darwin gathers for Geektacular cosplay event celebrating geek culture
item.description: Has a surge in the popularity of hit shows like Stranger Things led to an uptick in geekiness, changing how we feel about nerd culture? The ABC attended Darwin's Geektacular event to find out.

item.title: Why Alex de Minaur will lean into his 'selfish' side for the Australian Open
item.description: As the nation's great hope for the Australian Open, Alex de Minaur is ready to unleash his selfish side in an effort to secure his first grand slam title.

item.title: Ally Wollaston claims stage two of Tour Down Under to maintain race lead
item.description: Kiwi Ally Wollaston has outsprinted defending champion Noemi Ruegg to claim stage two of the Tour Down Under and keep the race lead.

item.title: Writers' Week letter shows premier backed removal of Randa Abdel-Fattah
item.description: South Australia's premier told the Adelaide Festival board it would open itself to "accusations of hypocrisy" and "legitimate public ridicule" if it did not cancel the appearance of Randa Abdel-Fattah from Writers' Week.

item.title: Hundreds of WA fishers congregate to protest against ban on demersal fishing
item.description: Around 200 disgruntled fishers have journeyed through the streets of Perth to protest against the state government's decision to ban demersal fishing, as the WA Premier Roger Cook confirmed he planned to meet with the industry.

item.title: Body found among wreckage of Indonesian plane that lost contact mid-flight
item.description: A body has been found among the wreckage of an Indonesian plane that lost contact mid-flight.

item.title: Venus Williams lost in the first round. But she still gave fans an emotional evening
item.description: Undisputed great of the sport Venus Williams was welcomed back to Melbourne Park with multiple standing ovations but bowed out in the first round to Serbian Olga Danilovic.

item.title: NATO allies warn Trump of 'dangerous downward spiral' over Greenland threats
item.description: The US president says European countries will be hit with tariffs until a deal is struck that would see the Danish territory become an American possession.

item.title: Trump asks Australia, Albanese to join Gaza 'Board of Peace'
item.description: The US president is pushing for the board to preserve a fragile ceasefire between Hamas and Israel and progress the peace deal to the next phase.

item.title: Unregulated fishing keeps Seahorse World locked out of traditional Chinese medicine market
item.description: A seahorse farm in Tasmania thought it was onto a sure thing; exporting dried seahorses to the Chinese market — it turned out not to be as easy as hoped.

item.title: What psychologists have to say about the seven types of rest
item.description: Have you ever found yourself still exhausted and deflated after an eight-hour sleep? Perhaps sleep isn't the reset you need.

item.title: AI platforms like Grok are an ethical, social and economic nightmare — and we're starting to wake up
item.description: As 2025 began, I thought humanity's biggest problem was climate change. In 2026, AI is more pressing.

item.title: Life in Cuba is about to get harder as Trump threatens oil supply
item.description: Many experts are predicting life in Cuba is about to get even harder.

item.title: What Trump has planned for 'the biggest birthday party ever' as the US turns 250
item.description: The United States of America is celebrating the 250th anniversary of its union as a nation and experts say Donald Trump appears to be exploiting the events for his own political gain.

item.title: Tribunal bans senior nurse for trying to take patient's medication, altering hospital records
item.description: A senior public hospital nurse has been prohibited from working for four years for attempting to steal medication from a patient and manipulating a co-worker's Facebook account in an attempt to cover it up.

item.title: Frustrated fans, Zverev confused and a ball kid collapses — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Fans were left queuing for hours after play started, Alexander Zverev got confused by a gate and Maria Sakkari smashed an insane shot. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Steve Smith amuses and delights, Sam Curran fires as the Sydney Sixers lock in BBL finals berth

item.description: The possible deployment comes after US President Donald Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act to quell anti-ICE protests in the state.

item.title: Calls for an industry-standard heat policy to be implemented on worksites as summers get hotter
item.description: It has been 13 years since Jenny Newport's son died from extreme heat while on a worksite in Queensland. She believes not much has changed.

item.title: The highly detailed, invisible work that goes into 'near real-time' bushfire mapping
item.description: As the devastating fires in Victoria spread earlier this month, people at home could see how they were moving across the state — not just in videos on the news and social media, but on an interactive map.

item.description: Parliament has returned ahead of schedule to honour the victims of the Bondi terror attack.

item.description: We’ve put together four recipes that are fun and easy enough for kids to help with.

item.title: Three performers talk about bringing their clown shows to Perth Fringe World
item.description: Three performers at Perth Fringe World talk about why the magic of clowning is getting adults to let down their walls and embrace their inner child.

item.title: Charles Darwin University researchers investigate whether old tyres can strengthen roads
item.description: Roads buckle under the pressure of the Northern Territory's harsh climate, but a group of researchers think repurposing discarded materials may be the solution — not only helping the environment, but government budgets too.

item.title: Conservationists alarmed by plan to remove rare bird habitat in Sydney's north-west
item.description: A set of ponds built for a since-shuttered abattoir in Sydney's north-west has become a habitat for rare migratory birds from Alaska and Antarctica.

item.description: In the heart of north Queensland, Ukrainians, Fijians, Zimbabweans and Koreans gather in the dirt to help each other grow vegetables.

item.description: Community leaders have called on the West Australian government to take concrete action as violence and crime associated with the illegal tobacco trade spreads to the state's Wheatbelt.

item.title: Explosives discovery in Kalgoorlie reno sparks memories of time when gelignite was sold in shops
item.description: A recent gelignite discovery during a Kalgoorlie renovation has brought back memories of a time when explosives were "freely available" in the mining city.

item.description: The 10-time champion joined Roger Federer at that milestone after he defeated Pedro Martinez in straight sets on day two.

item.description: Senegal's players storm off the pitch in furious protest of a refereeing decision late in the Africa Cup of Nations final, but then return to score an extra-time winner against Morocco.

item.description: As first-round opponents go, they do not come any tougher than Carlos Alcaraz, as Australia's Adam Walton found out.

item.description: Hundreds of statements gathered in murder case against Tanika Bromley.

item.title: Perth's median house price surges through $1m million mark, new data finds

item.description: Tensions between the United States and Greenland's allies reach a new high, with threats of increasing tariffs after European troops were sent to the island.

item.description: Steve Smith has lit up the Big Bash since returning to the Sydney Sixers, but concedes the ship has sailed for him to play in next month's T20 World Cup.

item.description: Roger Allers was known for working on various Disney films including The Lion King, The Little Mermaid and Aladdin.

item.title: Elphinstone Engineering director sentenced for interfering with Aboriginal relics
item.description: Graeme Elphinstone, the founder and director of Elphinstone Engineering, avoids conviction and is fined $12,000 for interfering with Aboriginal relics on his land on Tasmania's east coast.

item.description: Professional and recreational shooters say they want to see extensive community consultation before any changes are made to the ACT's gun laws.

item.description: A ruptured Achilles tendon threatened to send Storm Hunter into retirement, but her perseverance pays off with a first-round victory in Melbourne.

item.description: In one of Australia's hottest towns, the library is an important air-conditioned public space offering a no-cost respite from burning summer temperatures.

item.description: Burnt out storefronts in Perth and regional cities are testament to the government's inability to control the illegal tobacco trade — and it's not clear when things will change, writes Keane Bourke.

item.description: People living in Kalumburu, one of the most remote communities in Western Australia's far north, are being warned of rising river levels and floods, after heavy rain.

item.description: Victoria's Environment Protection Authority says people wanting to cool off at bay beaches this summer should stay across its regular pollution updates.

item.description: National data shows that in 2025, China's population shrank by 3.39 million people, as experts warn the trend is likely to continue.

item.title: First Nations employee asked by supervisor about eating ants takes transport department to court

item.title: ASX trades down, BHP shares slide, IMF calls out Australia's 'drawn-out' inflation — as it happened
item.description: The ASX trades down on Tuesday. The International Monetary Fund says Australia, alongside Norway, is projected to see persistent above-target inflation. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Front lines in 'ghost net' war expand to Australia's north with $25m funding boost
item.description: A $25 million funding injection will help expand the Top End's war on ghost nets, as ranger groups shift focus to the heavily fished seas to Australia's north.

item.title: WA Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas seizes on fishing, tobacco to challenge government's dominance
item.description: While many West Australians were competing for parking spots at beaches on their holidays, Basil Zempilas latched onto two hot topics on which to challenge the government — the demersal fishing ban and WA's illicit tobacco trade.

item.title: Pilbara water sources drying up as blistering heatwave continues in Karratha
item.description: Water sources are depleting in the Pilbara as the arid region endures a summer with little rainfall and temperatures close to 50C.

item.title: Morocco accepts Trump's invite to 'peace' board as Putin yet to decide
item.description: Morocco's King Mohammed VI is the latest leader to accept an invitation to join US President Donald Trump's so-called "Board of Peace", as Russian President Vladimir Putin weighs up his invitation.

item.title: Brisbane suffers vaccine shortages after wall collapses at Toll Group distribution centre
item.description: Brisbane parents are being turned away from GP clinics due to a shortage of childhood vaccines.

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Naomi Osaka sends a fashion statement, Dane Sweeny and James Duckworth progress
item.description: Seeing Naomi Osaka don a jellyfish-inspired outfit was one highlight of day three of the tournament, however two plucky Australians — Dane Sweeny and James Duckworth also put on a show.

item.title: Eraring coal-fired power station to stay open until 2029
item.description: The operator of Australia's largest coal-fired power station is to extend the life of its plant in the NSW Hunter Valley for another two years.

item.title: Dual British-Australian citizens look to renounce UK nationality over new passport entry rules
item.description: Frustrated dual British-Australian citizens are weighing up their options in response to new passport rules. Here's why some are letting go of their British citizenship.

item.title: UN rapporteur on allegations of crimes against humanity in Iran
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: How a lion crushed a Datsun with newlyweds inside in 1970s Adelaide
item.description: The pair had made an on-the-spot decision on the way home from their honeymoon to visit a drive-through safari park where lions roamed free — and their little brown Datsun came out worse for wear.

item.title: Mile Jedinak joins Socceroos coaching staff ahead of FIFA World Cup as Australia reveals warm-up opponents
item.description: The former Australian captain is back in the fold for another World Cup, except this time he will be on the sidelines as one of the team's coaches.

item.title: Surfer bitten by shark at Point Plomer on NSW Mid North Coast
item.description: The 39-year-old man was surfing at Point Plomer, near Crescent Head, this morning when the shark bit through his board.

item.title: Jessica Pegula reveals what goes on inside the Australian Open locker room
item.description: According to Jessica Pegula, sometimes it is best to stay out of your opponent's way when you are sharing the same locker room.

item.title: Six people charged after investigation into footage of burnouts and fireworks on Brisbane's Gateway Bridge on New Year's Eve
item.description: Police allege several vehicles blocked northbound lanes of Brisbane's Gateway Motorway at Murarrie before a group performed burnouts and let off fireworks just before midnight.

item.title: Increase in suspicious fires puts emergency services under pressure in WA's South West
item.description: A growing number of suspicious fires left police and firefighters under significant pressure over the Christmas period.

item.title: Labor's hate laws pass despite a divided Coalition
item.description: The federal government has passed new laws targeting hate groups with support from the Liberals, while the Nationals voted against it.

item.title: ABC appoints Isabella Higgins as new host of AM radio program
item.description: The former Europe correspondent succeeds Sabra Lane, who has announced she will step down after nine years of presenting.

item.title: Canadian 19-year-old found dead on K'gari (Fraser Island) identified as Piper James
item.description: The woman was found surrounded by dingoes after going for an early-morning swim.

item.title: Why could Donald Trump's Board of Peace be a threat to the United Nations?
item.description: Donald Trump appears to be trying to build his own international peacekeeping body, which he calls the "Board of Peace". Here's why experts think it might attempt to rival the UN.

item.title: Brain cancer survivor who finished year 12 hoping medication can get PBS listing
item.description: Just over a year ago Sienna was shocked to discover she had a rare brain cancer. She's taking a new drug to slow its growth, but it's come at great cost.

item.title: Families of officers killed at Wieambilla call for gun reform as Queensland rejects buyback scheme
item.description: Judy McCrow says the families "fully support" the federal government's proposed gun buyback scheme and are calling on political parties to stop "bickering".

item.title: Man, 29, charged with bushland murder of Matthew O'Brien
item.description: Police have charged a 29-year-old man after the alleged murder of a 60-year-old man, who was found with serious head injuries on a fire trail in Nowra in December 2024.

item.title: French media releases new security footage of thieves in Louvre heist
item.description: The security footage shows the thieves smashing the glass on the display cases where the jewellery was kept.

item.title: Gilmour Space receives federal funding boost for homegrown rockets
item.description: The company hailed the launch of its first Australian designed and manufactured rocket a success, despite it being airborne for just 14 seconds.

item.title: Parole Board seeks judicial review of decision blocking release of Snowtown killer James Vlassakis
item.description: South Australia's Parole Board has confirmed it will lodge an application for a judicial review of the decision to keep the youngest of the Snowtown killers James Vlassakis behind bars.

item.title: Writers' Week replacement likened to 'thought bubble', but backer says it is 'happening regardless'
item.description: Adelaide City Council commits to supporting, but not funding, a replacement event to fill the void left by Writers' Week, as the lord mayor describes the proposal as "not much more" than a "thought bubble".

item.title: UN representative says Iran's death toll is rising and there could be investigations into 'crimes against humanity'
item.description: An independent fact-finding mission should investigate potential crimes against humanity committed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, according a UN-appointed representative.

item.title: Brooklyn Beckham has cut ties with his famous parents. What can we learn from it?
item.description: Celebrity family rifts are not new. Experts weigh in on how they can spark negative feelings about our own family dynamics.

item.title: Four shark attacks in 48 hours on NSW beaches. What do we know about them?
item.description: Four shark attacks are documented within 48 hours at beaches across New South Wales, lifting the anxieties of swimmers and surfers who are considering a dip in the ocean.

item.title: One Nation's ambitious plan raises stakes for major parties
item.description: While she's made no secret of her desire to eventually unseat Anthony Albanese, the One Nation leader's immediate electoral strategy is to gain ground at upcoming state elections.

item.title: NSW Police commissioner extends Sydney protest restrictions with 'significantly limited' scope
item.description: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon has announced restrictions on protests in parts of the state will be extended.

item.title: Three federal politicians demand incoming NT administrator David Connolly apologise for 'offensive' posts
item.description: Past social media posts made by incoming Northern Territory administrator David Connolly have been labelled "reprehensible" by three federal politicians, who are also demanding he apologise.

item.title: Maya Joint vows to 'come back stronger' after early Australian Open exit
item.description: Maya Joint's first Australian Open appearance as a seed did not go according to plan, following a straight-sets defeat on Tuesday.

item.title: Hackers disrupt Iranian state TV to support exiled crown prince
item.description: Hackers break into Iranian state television satellite transmissions to air footage supporting the country's exiled former prince and calling on security forces to lay down their weapons.

item.title: Antarctic penguin breeding cycles changing rapidly in response to climate change, study shows
item.description: Penguins in parts of Antarctica are breeding up to two weeks earlier than a decade ago, likely in response to climate change, according to a long-term study.

item.title: Surf webcam captures moment of shark attack at North Steyne beach
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Valentino's legacy as 'one of the last true titans' of Italian fashion
item.description: "Valentino red", now synonymous with the Italian designer, was introduced to the world in 1959. But it wasn't until years later he commanded true global attention — and with an entirely different dress.

item.title: Aussie Dylan Joyce's punt blocked for a touchdown as Indiana down Miami in college football title game
item.description: A few months ago, Indiana had the worst record in college football history, and while the Sooners have completed one of the greatest rises in American sports to win the national championship against Miami, it came following a tough moment for an Australian import.

item.title: Patients relocated at Calvary Mater Hospital after maggot discovery
item.description: Patients have been transferred out of the Calvary Mater Hospital in Newcastle after maggots were discovered in a hospital room.

item.title: Blue Mountains council closes Lincoln's Rock lookout after safety concerns
item.description: A council will shut an iconic Blue Mountains cliff after being overrun with tourists, sparking serious safety and environmental concerns.

item.title: Prime minister, WA premier pay tribute to former Labor political strategist Tim Picton
item.description: The death of Labor identity Tim Picton rocks his former political colleagues, prompting warnings from WA's police minister about the devastating consequences of one-punch assaults.

item.title: Hawthorn's Will Day to miss first half of the AFL season with shoulder injury
item.description: Hawthorn star Will Day is set for a lengthy stint on the sidelines after dislocating his right shoulder during pre-season training and undergoing surgery.

item.title: Sydney NDIS provider director accused of $3.6m fraud as cash seized at home
item.description: Australian Federal Police allege Billal Chami submitted claims for supports and services never provided to participants.

item.title: CCTV of kitten dumping in Adelaide's north-east
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Thousands in Albany told to switch to LPG bottles as gas supplier ATCO decommissions network
item.description: The Albany mayor says the city has been blindsided by a decision to decommission the local gas network and transition thousands of customers onto bottled LPG gas.

item.title: Midnight Oil founder and drummer Rob Hirst dies aged 70
item.description: Rob Hirst was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in 2023.

item.title: Do Woolworths shoppers want Google AI adding items to buy? We'll soon find out
item.description: Without scrutiny, agent-led shopping risks quietly reconfiguring consumer behaviour in ways that are difficult to detect — and even harder to reverse.

item.title: Deborah Roberts not guilty after mass cattle death at Old Man Plains Research Station
item.description: Deborah Roberts has been cleared after being charged with animal cruelty and a failure to provide a minimum level of care.

item.title: Is there a 'normal' amount of sex couples should be having?
item.description: Whether it's TV shows or what our friends say, we pick up an idea of "normal" sex frequency from lots of places. But experts say how often you're having sex doesn't tell you much about whether it's satisfying or enjoyable.

item.title: Helen Manuell changed careers in her 50s from bridal design to sustainable fashion
item.description: Helen Manuell changed career paths in her 50s, swapping bridal couture for award-winning sustainable fashion.

item.title: Maggot-infested meal halts work at $1 billion hydro project
item.description: An investigation into a maggot-infested meal halts work on a key pumped hydro project in North Queensland, with more than 100 workers flown out.

item.title: Queensland health services report financial black hole of almost $1 billion as population booms and ages
item.description: The combined deficit of Queensland's health department and 16 hospital and health services in 2024-25 was the worst ever reported in the state.

item.title: Teacher loses bid to win job back after 'inappropriate behaviour' toward women
item.description: A disqualified Adelaide teacher fails to get his job back after a tribunal upholds a decision to terminate his employment over his "inappropriate behaviour" toward women.

item.title: WA environmental regulator recommends controversial Valhalla gas project go-ahead in Kimberley
item.description: Traditional owners and environmental groups are calling on the premier and environment minister to reject a controversial proposal to explore gas wells in the Kimberley.

item.title: WA government calls for unity on firearm reforms as Liberal-led states reject national gun buyback
item.description: The state government responsible for the Australia's toughest gun laws calls for unity on national reform, as the path forward splinters along party lines.

item.title: MPs can still take partners and children on work trips under new family travel rules
item.description: Politicians can still charge taxpayers for taking their partners and children on work-related trips outside Canberra under tighter new rules set independently.

item.title: Hobart Hurricanes lose captain Nathan Ellis and Test batsman Jake Weatherald for Big Bash knockout final
item.description: Hobart's quest for back-to-back Big Bash titles has copped two major blows with captain Nathan Ellis and Test player Jake Weatherald to miss the Hurricanes' knockout final against Melbourne Renegades.

item.title: Transport Canberra launches investigation into cybersecurity risks in Chinese-built electric buses
item.description: Transport Canberra investigates potential cybersecurity risks in its fleet of Chinese-built electric buses after reports that UK security agencies found vehicles from the same manufacturer could be remotely turned off using a "kill switch".

item.title: Donald Trump shares messages from Emmanuel Macron offering G7 meeting after Davos
item.description: US President Donald Trump has shared a private message purportedly from his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron ahead of a global economic forum in Davos, Switzerland.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Israeli authorities begin demolishing former UNRWA compound in East Jerusalem
item.description: The UN has labelled Israel's move to bulldoze a former UNRWA headquarters a "serious violation of international law".

item.title: Farmers Federation slams WA's heritage laws 'a complete mess' and questions enforcement
item.description: There are calls for the state government to revisit the state's Aboriginal heritage laws, which WA farmers say could result in media outlets being fined thousands of dollars for publishing images of culturally protected heritage sites.

item.title: Thirsty camels searching for water cause damage in Central Australian outback
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: 'Large bull camels weighing hundreds of kilos' move into NT communities
item.description: Hundreds of large bull camels descend on remote communities in Central Australia, causing damage to infrastructure in their search for water and prompting calls for federal assistance.

item.title: Sam Watson wins Tour Down Under prologue, Jay Vine finishes fourth
item.description: British rider Sam Watson claimed a blisteringly quick Tour Down Under prologue time-trial victory, but Jay Vine took significant time out of his rivals.

item.title: Dame Marie Bashir, the first female governor of NSW, dies aged 95
item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns says a state funeral will be held for the veteran public servant, who he describes as "an extraordinary Australian".

item.title: UK backs plan for China's new embassy in London at Royal Mint Court, despite spy fears
item.description: The new embassy will sit in the city's Royal Mint Court alongside London's famous financial hub, despite experts and human rights groups raising concerns about foreign interference.
